favourite.article: Always lifts my spirit!
I bless God for this hymn. It is wonderful.
Truly I want to see Thy footsteps oh Lord & in them may mine also be planted.... I promised to serve Thee till the end oh God...
Lord You are my Master, please lead in the part that I should go.
Feeling Blessed
I am blessed by this hymn anytime any day. God bless my blessed country Nigeria.

This song is spiritual warfare. I learned this some time ago. Sing it when you are facing spiritual oppression-- especially in the form of anxiety or depression-- and the heaviness just lifts. Something about this song really puts agents to flight. Sing it regularly and really internalize the message; make it a sincere, personal pledge.
Lord, even if the environment strongly holds me to not serve You, this I promised: to serve Thee to the end. Not because i'm good, it's just because Thy mercy and Thy love.
We sang this song in church today, it ministered so strongly that all the sermon was centered on the hymn. Jesus I promise to serve You, help me my Master and Friend. Amen.

What a reassuring song. Lord you are my master and my friend. All that I have is You. Even in this trying moment I have no single doubt that You will surely lift me up in victory. You are all that I have.

Thank You Jesus! Thank You Holy Spirit for singing this hymn in my heart. Thank You so much my dear Lord for speaking to me through this hymn and these words. Blessed be Your Holy name O Lord in Jesus name. Amen!

When Jesus comes into our life after conviction and repentance and forgiveness we experience our first love full of hope and trust. From that moment on Satan will try to take it away and undermine it with doubt, pride, temptation and trials. This song addresses all of these. Let's read or sing it often to be aware and keep our first love for Jesus.
This song makes me feel closer to Jesus.

It's really nice to be reasured once again about the promises of God, but my beloved let's not forget our ultimate goal, that is to populate the kingdom of heaven. Let's win more Souls for Christ. God bless you all.
I'm blessed.. My song any day. It gives encouragement for service. Thanks to the composer.

In the prayer this morning, the hymn came to me, as I sang I was missing words. Never thought of searching on the net, know hymn will be on net but I heard the Spirit of God say you use to google. Google this one. Thanks a lot for this hymn. I'm blessed already. Thanks
Am always reassuring and uplifting song in times of distress and victory.
Jesus: my Master and my Friend!

I remember, just like it was yesterday, kneeling by the side of the river, where I was baptized. My tear filled eyes glowed with joy unspeakable, knowing that whatever things betide, I'll never walk alone.

I fell in love with this hymn the very first time I heard it. I remember an overwhelming feeling sweeping through me. 14years later it still fills my eyes with tears...I shall not fear the battle if Thou art by my side. Nothing calms my soul quite like this reassuring hymn does.

I remember that particular night when the devil came with his devices, oh how glorious it is to have Jesus as the guardian of your soul. I woke up with this song with tears of joy and assurance that Jesus is the guardian of my soul. Hoiw comforting that could be. Thank you Jesus, I will serve the to the end.no matter what come against me, I know with you on my side nothing, absolutely nothing can take me out of thy hand. I love you Lord.
Jesus is my friend, knowing and serving Him is what I can't regret doing. I love You Lord wth all my heart, spirit, soul and body.
A refreshing song.

May God give us Grace to follow Him to the end in Jesus Name Amen. Oh Lord speak and make us to listen, Thou guardian of our souls. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. All blessings.
A very refreshing hymn. Lord, let me see thy footmarks, And in them plant mine own. Help me walk with thee to the end my Savior and my Friend.

Singing this song recently, the discernment that Jesus, the Lord of Lords, the King of Kings, Holy of Holies, is the Guardian of my soul got me so profoundly humbled. And then the truth of the opposite scenario hit me: what a terrifying jungle it must be to have Satan as the guardian of one's unsaved soul!
I love You Lord, Amen. Be my keeper for ever.
O Jesus, Thank You for Your kind assurances that You will always be with me and my family till the end of time. Yes, You are always with us, Amen.

As we have promised to serve God to the end, may we not look back in Jesus Name. The grace to follow to the end, we receive in Jesus Name. Please Jesus draw Thou nearer and shield our souls from sins in Jesus Name. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!!!
I can't do everything on my own. Oh give me grace to follow!
Jesus remains my Master and my Guide, my Shield, The Guardian of my soul, my Saviour and Friend. He is my everything !!!!!!!!
Your each and every word is inpiring to those who are following the TRUE path of the Son of God!
Jesus uphold me and my family to the end in Jesus name.
This hymn refreshes and reassures my soul. Thank you for having it here.

Today (March 3) I read Streams in the Desert, " when we are born again, it is not into a soft and protected nursery but into the open countryside, where we actually draw our strength from the distress of the storm." The words of this song immediately came to mind. This reminds me of my Confirmation vows over 50 years ago. I have not always been faithful to my promise but the Eternal has always been faithful to His. Bless Him forever!!
O' Lord my Friend and my Father, help me to follow You to the end, give me sufficient grace o Lord my God.
Lord, give me the grace to follow You till the end.
My Lord Jesus, please grant my the grace to fulfil this promise in my time, most especially this year.
God still have me. He is very faithful.
Inspirational song.

As we have promised to serve God to the end, may we not look back in Jesus Name. The grace to follow to the end, we receive in Jesus Name. Jesus will draw near us everyday. Thanks for uploading this song. God bless.
O speak to reassure me, to hasten or control, O speak and make listen, Thou Guardian of my soul.
Re dedication today on Pentecost Sunday. We thank God for good Christian upbringing. Truly hymns inspire!
This hymn makes me happy. When I am angry it makes me cry. Sometimes I remember when I am in j s s 1 and 2. It is always what I read when I am less busy and even in my primary.
One of the most beautiful hymns.
I remember this hymn from when I first went to school at 5 in Storey Street, North Woolwich and still in my heart today at the age of 45.
Very nice.

Oh what a spirit-filled song. I am doing my quiet time and the song came to my spirit. we used to sing it in those days as a child in secondary school and in the Anglican church where I grew up. My children and I will serve You Lord to the very end. may God bless the composer of this song and and also bless those that find time to put it on the net in Jesus name.
Beautiful and sweet melody.

This song always reminds me of my ordination vow and I always renew my allegience to my Lord and Savior. There are many persecutions faced by the clergy, but the one who called us is faithful. Christ walked through rejection unto crucifiction, but emerged victorious; thus we follow His footsteps. Be blessed as we sing this song always.
Bless Your name sweet Jesus even in the face of the enemy.
Thank You Jesus for tonight, it is awesome. May I hear Your sweet voice even as I sleep tonight, amen.
My Cry to Ma God.

This song has, is and will always be the cry of my heart to God. He is the reason I live and may my life truly be lived for Him and Him alone. A true living sacrifice of sweet smelling savour, acceptable unto Him.
Just what I was looking for. How can I download the song?

The verses of this song minister to me wonderfully. It is all I want to say to God to be at my side, to draw me closer to Him, to speak and make me listen, to serve Him till the end and then in heaven receive me, Amen.

When John Bode served the parish at Castle Camps, near Cambridge, England, in the middle of the 19th century, he had the privilege of officiating at the confirmation of his daughter and 2 sons. This hymn was written specifically for this occasion, and originally the 1st line was, "O Jesus, we have promised" because all 3 children were making this dedication of themselves to the Lord. - Great Songs of Faith by Brown & Norton
I love this song with passion. It gives me courage to continue in this life and it makes me to remember the promise I made to God. I will serve Him in all my life time.

I thank God for the inspiration to write such beautiful songs in the ancient days. It has helped we Christians of this generation in our Christian walk with God. Very inspiring indeed. God bless the writer and composer.

After reaching workplace and making a cup of tea, this song came into my mind and I started humming thinking of my good old days at school. Since I forgot the lyrics I seached Internet and here I am with this beautiful word that blesses me. Thanks a lot for whoever put this song on the net for simple page flip. Remember God takes cares of everybody both good and bad. Thank You Almighty God. God Bless everyone. Amen.
Such a beautiful hymn that reminds us of our lives as Christians and what we hope for in Christ.

This old hymn came to mind today. I remember sing this in Sunday School, many years ago. I thought I'd look it up on the internet and found this. So happy I did. The words are so perfect for everyone's life. Praise God!
We were making giving pledges in church for 2013 and this is a perfect one to tell God what we are promising. May God help us fulfill our vows as a church and as individuals. Amen.

On reading a friend's sermon this morning it led me to search out this hymn and really listen. I was then reminded of the beauty and simplicity (despite the challenges) of what I am called to. Thanks be to God for faithful friends who in small things can provide such encouragement on the journey.

I was doing my morning devotion when the song came across my mind, I quickly searched on the internet and found this. Thanks for making this available, may God reward you richly. By the way a lot of Nigerians use this website, that's quite commendable.
This is to be the Desperate Heart Cry of ANYONE who desires to Walk with God is the Fullness of His GLORY! Connect with the Spirit behind the letters.
I sang this hymn in high school at our morning devotions it was and remains my favorite hymn of all time.

This morning the lyrics of a hymn, "O Jesus I Have Promised," came to mind as I was waking up. More than that, understanding the Lord's goodness and mercy to me, I consecrate this day and my life in service to Him!!!
This song is a blessing to me. I woke up with the song in my spirit, and l could only remember the 1st stanza. Thanks so much for making it available on net. God bles you.

As I awoke this morning, the words of this hymn were on my heart and mind. What a wonderful confirmation of God's faithfulness and reminder of my commitment. This website enabled me to review and refresh in my mind the whole hymn.

As if someone had been singing this hymn inside of me. Not knowing all of the line perfectly, I had to check it out, only to find God expressing exactly what I feel, the way I feel it. God bless those ancient hands that wrote it. Wonderful. Oh yes. It's been a blessing.

I just discovered this site today. I wsh to express my happiness that there are children of God who are sincerely concerned about spiritual things in these days when, all over the world, people are preoccupied with the world and its affairs.
This hymn is truly inspiring. I solemnly promise to serve Jesus to the end. May His grace abound and see me through to the end of time. Amen.

John & I plan to sing this song at our 50th Wedding Anniversary on June 16th, 2012. We sang this song in our wedding ceremony 50 years ago. It was a commitment to serve our God as a minister and his wife to the end. He has given us the grace to follow Him througout our 50 years together.

This hymn was included our church service this weekend and I want to share it with my friends. With so many troubles in this country and abroad, it is good to have something simple to fall back upon when you are anxious or stressed! Please link to this page and listen -- read the words -- may they bring peace to you as they have me. Yours in Christ -- Sharon

I am planning on being a missionary to the Hausa of Nigeria. This song reminds me especially in the hard times of my life that "O Jesus, I Have Promised" to serve thee wherever I am and in the future as a missionary to Nigeria.

This song is spirit lifting to me. The last is the highlight for all believers. It remind me that it takes the grace and mercy of God to be steadfast in this Christian race. May the Almighty God uphold us to the end.

PTL for technology! I awoke with the words "O Jesus I have promised to serve thee to the end". And after too many years the next few words escaped me. He truly is my Master and my Friend. Thank you for ALL the words.

I was exposed to this and humdreds of others at a very early age; this one at about 3 or 4 and the Spirit of God has used it through the years to remind me of who and Whose's I am. Praise God for the old Spirit-filled hymns. Will singing this one tonight in Prayer meeting/Bible study as a renewed committment. Bless all of you at the website.
This is a very lovely and spirit-filled hymn. May God help me to continually hope in Him. I promised to serve You to the end.

God put it in my heart as a child; He woke me up this morning with it on my lips. Through all this worldly strife, and even in my happiest moments, nothing compares to God; there is no greater height than to experience a love such as this. He is ever near me and will see me through the end.
I love this song because the wish of my soul is to serve You, Oh my Lord Jesus. But I'm weak. Please, help me and I will. I want just to serve You my King.
What a beautiful song of hope and encouragement. Oh! how I desire so much for a perfect inspiring song such as this. God bless you and the writer.
The hymn is heart softening and it teaches the importance of listening to the Saviour Lord Jesus Christ.
This song always makes me conscious of my promise to serve God and His assurance to always be with me till the end of the age.
Have you ever faced adversaries? If yes, have this song, sing it every day and you will be victorious.
Thank God for your hymns. They gave me the inspiration I have never had in the last few years.
I long for the time when I can leave this world totally behind and be nearer to my Saviour, as I am finding it hard staying close with the distractions and presures of everyday life here.
